The biggest and highest pride of Valve, which tore up the entire gaming industry in 1998 with the release of the first part of HALF-LIFE and with the release of the second part in 2004.
Gordon Freeman, the hero of the HALF-LIFE series of games, forced to correct his mistakes in black mesa, must fix everything and save humanity. Humanity is dying out, evil is destroying everything valuable in the world of people and actively continue to devastate the resources of planet Earth.
The action of the game begins in the city of City 17, where we, under the guise of an ordinary civilian, come to the occupied city by the Alliance, we see that there are metropolitan police everywhere and in case of any action that the metropolis does not like, get a shock baton in the face. (Listen to how Putin's slaves beat up Navalny's clowns) Among the metropolitan police is a spy, our old friend Barney from black Mesa, who helps Freeman hide from the metropolis, though not for long and tells all the things that are happening in the world. In the attempts of the metropolitan police to arrest us, the beloved Alex comes to our aid, who in the following parts will run after us everywhere like a tail.
There are no disadvantages!
Positive:
1) Very cool game plot;
2) Very well-designed locations and graphics for their time, which even today can compete with any novelty;
3) A good soundtrack;
4) Not a poor arsenal of weapons at that time.
5) Very cleverly designed NN, which then became a breakthrough in the gaming industry. These are the first bots that do not run headlong into your bullets, but change tactics against you in every possible way
The game deserves a 20/10 score and is recommended for purchase. For 259 rubles, you will get a decent game that will actively flaunt in your STEAM library
. P.S. I bought it when Steam was just developing and bought a disc of The Orange Box collection
我不要half life3我要half life 2+1或者half life 4-1

Reviewing purely as a game i played first in 2021, Obviously late to this but thought it worth checking out as a "classic" I haven't played. I can understand why it was groundbreaking at the time but not sure it really holds up as a must play today except for the nostalgia factor. The game is fine and the physics puzzles and gravity gun are good but nothing to get me too excited. Nice that despite being quite linear there are generally rewards for exploring a bit.

Personally the plot has so far left me the most disappointed as never really engaged me. 10 hours in and might finish it for the completion factor but might well put in a few more hours and be done with it. Obviously I am looking at it with 2021 eyes but was hoping for a bit more from the game since it is so highly revered in gaming circles. Still just about recommend rather than not but if there was a neutral thumbs sideways option that would have been my rating.

Rise and shine, Mr. Freeman. Rise and shine. Not that I wish to imply you have been sleeping on the job. No one is more deserving of a rest. And all the effort in the world would have gone to waste until...well, let's just say your hour has come again. The right man in the wrong place can make all the difference in the world. So, wake up, Mr. Freeman. Wake up and smell the ashes.

...time, Dr. Freeman? Is it really that time again? It seems as if you only just arrived. You've done a great deal in a small timespan. You've done so well, in fact, that I've received some interesting offers for your services. Ordinarily, I wouldn't contemplate them. But these are extraordinary times. Rather than offer you the illusion of free choice, I will take the liberty of choosing for you...if and when your time comes around again. I do apologize for what must seem to you an arbitrary imposition, Dr. Freeman. I trust it will all make sense to you in the course of...well... I'm really not at liberty to say. In the meantime... This is where I get off.	

Doctor Freeman. I realize this moment may not be the most convenient for a heart-to-heart, but I had to wait until your friends were otherwise occupied. Hm. There was a time they cared nothing for Miss Vance... When their only experience of humanity was a crowbar coming at them down a steel corridor. When I plucked her from Black Mesa, I acted in the face of objections that she was a mere child and of no practical use to anyone. I have learned to ignore such naysayers when quelling them was out of the question. Still, I am not one to squander my investments... and I remain confident she was worth far more than the initial...appraisal.	That's why I must now extract from you some small repayment owed for your own survival. See her safely to White Forest, Doctor Freeman. I wish I could do more than keep an eye on you, but I have agreed to abide by certain... restrictions. Mmm. Well... Now... Listen carefully, my dear. When you see your father relay these words: Prepare for unforeseen consequences.
